questions.uddipok:
Complete the sentences using suitable clauses/phrases.
(a) Your H.S.C Examination is knocking at the door. You have to study attentively so that _______.
(b) Time flies very fast. Five years have passed since _______.
(c) I got a scholarship when _______. Everybody was happy.
(d) I was very busy with my examination. If I _______, I would have joined your birthday celebration.
(e) A village market is a place where _______. This place is full of hue and cry.
(f) Their salary is so high. The government should assist him lest _______.
(g) Early rising gives a man enough free time. Had I been an early riser, _______.
(h) There is nobody _______. Hence happiness is a relative term.
(i) I worked hard although _______.
(j) The crown is a symbol of a king. Uneasy lies the head _______.

sub_questions.explanation:
There is no fixed answer in this part , anything that matches the sentences with proper grammar is acceptable.

(a) Your H.S.C Examination is knocking at the door. You have to study attentively so that you can do well in the exam . (b) Time flies very fast. Five years have passed since we left school . (c) I got a scholarship when I stood first in the board exam . Everybody was happy. (d) I was very busy with my examination. If I had got time , I would have joined your birthday celebration. (e) A village market is a place where people buy and sell daily necessities . This place is full of hue and cry. (f) Their salary is so high. The government should assist him lest he should face financial problems . (g) Early rising gives a man enough free time. Had I been an early riser, I could have finished my tasks earlier . (h) There is nobody who gets everything he wants . Hence happiness is a relative term. (i) I worked hard although I was not feeling well . (j) The crown is a symbol of a king. Uneasy lies the head that wears the crown .

questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph within 200 words describing the "Importance of Tree Plantation".

sub_questions.explanation:
Importance of Tree Plantation
Tree plantation plays a vital role in maintaining ecological balance and ensuring a healthy environment. Trees are often called the “lungs of the Earth” because they absorb carbon dioxide and release oxygen, which is essential for all living beings. They help reduce air pollution, prevent soil erosion, and maintain the fertility of the land. Tree roots hold the soil firmly and prevent landslides and floods. Moreover, trees provide shade, reduce the temperature, and act as natural air conditioners, especially in urban areas.
Trees are also a source of food, medicine, and raw materials for many industries. They provide shelter and habitat to countless birds and animals, supporting biodiversity. In addition, forests created through tree plantations play a significant role in maintaining the water cycle by attracting rainfall and preserving underground water levels.
In today’s world, where deforestation and climate change are growing threats, tree plantation is more important than ever. It is a simple but effective way to combat global warming and protect the environment for future generations. Therefore, individuals, communities, and governments must take active steps to plant more trees and protect existing ones. Tree plantation is not just an environmental duty—it is an investment in a greener, healthier future.

questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph on "The Causes and Effects of Road Accident" within 200 words.

sub_questions.explanation:
The Causes and Effects of Road Accidents
Road accidents are a major concern in modern society, causing thousands of deaths and injuries every year. There are several causes behind road accidents. One of the most common reasons is reckless or careless driving, including speeding, overtaking, and ignoring traffic signals. Drunk driving, using mobile phones while driving, and driving without proper training also contribute heavily to road mishaps. Poor road conditions, lack of street lights, and absence of proper traffic management systems further increase the risk. In some cases, mechanical failure of vehicles can also lead to serious accidents.
The effects of road accidents are often devastating. They cause loss of lives, permanent injuries, and emotional trauma to victims and their families. Many people lose their ability to work, which leads to financial difficulties. Accidents also cause damage to vehicles and public property, increasing repair and medical costs. On a larger scale, they create traffic jams and reduce the overall efficiency of transportation systems.
To reduce road accidents, strict traffic rules must be enforced, roads should be maintained properly, and drivers must be educated about safe driving practices. Public awareness and responsible behavior on the road are essential to ensure safety for all.
